intro: Diocirea ternata, commonly known as the three-leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, three-lobed leaves and has a rapid growth rate, often seen as a weed in agricultural settings. Its flowers are typically blue or purple and bloom in the early morning, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant contains alkaloids and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
